author: Staff Reporter
text:
District Crime Branch police registered a cheating case against J. Pushpa Rani (51), and her sons J. Christian (28) and J. Giriyan of Chinnathurai in Thoothur village on Saturday.

According to the police, the three received Rs. 10 lakh from one J. Mary Matilda (42) during October 2011 for buying a fishing boat.

At the time of getting money, they promised to share the profit to be accrued by selling their catch but failed to do so for the last five years.

When Ms. Mary Matilda asked them to return her money, the trio allegedly threatened her.

On the basis of a complaint lodged by Ms. Mary Matilda, the District Crime Branch police registered a case under Section 420 (cheating) of the Indian Penal Code. Further investigations are on.
title: Woman cheated of Rs. 10 lakh
